I'll build a CRM backend for you where you can add contacts, assign tags, create campaigns, and send emails to contacts filtered by tags. I'll ensure the backend is robust, well-structured, and ready for frontend integration.

**Based on your request, the backend will include:**
- Contact management (CRUD)
- Tag management and tag assignment to contacts (many-to-many)
- Campaign creation (with subject, body, and tag targeting)
- Email sending functionality (campaign emails sent to contacts with selected tags)
- Proper relational models and API endpoints for all entities
- Clean, scalable code with error handling and integration-tested endpoints

**Design decisions for this backend:**
- **Models:** Contact, Tag, Campaign, ContactTag (association table), CampaignSend (email log)
- **Email Sending:** For now, implement a mock email sender (real SMTP integration can be added later)
- **Authentication:** Not implemented for backend-only phase (can be added later if needed)
- **Database:** Use SQLAlchemy for relational modeling, Pydantic v2 for request/response schemas
- **API Structure:** RESTful endpoints for all entities, plus campaign send endpoint

---

**Search Results:**
CRM backend features and design patterns involve several key considerations for effective customer relationship management. Here's a breakdown:

**Backend Features:**
*   **Contact Management:** Organize and access customer information, including contact details and interaction history ([Salesforce](https://www.salesforce.com/crm/features)).
*   **Single Source of Truth:** Consolidate customer data from various teams and systems for a unified view ([Salesforce](https://www.salesforce.com/crm/features)).
*   **AI Integration:** Utilize AI for predictive analysis, identifying potential deals, and generating personalized content ([Salesforce](https://www.salesforce.com/crm/features)).
*   **Reports, Dashboards, and Analytics:** Provide clear views of data to improve customer relationships and boost sales ([Salesforce](https://www.salesforce.com/crm/features)).
*   **Automation and Workflows:** Automate tasks and create workflows to increase productivity ([Salesforce](https://www.salesforce.com/crm/features)).
*   **Data Security:** Implement strong data security measures to protect customer information ([Medium](https://medium.com/@adam.fard/crm-design-best-practices-966bbb1d60c5)).

**Design Patterns:**
*   **Understand Your Audience:** Research customer needs and preferences to inform design decisions ([Medium](https://medium.com/@adam.fard/crm-design-best-practices-966bbb1d60c5)).
*   **User-Friendly Design:** Ensure an intuitive and easy-to-navigate interface with clear labels and layouts ([Medium](https://medium.com/@adam.fard/crm-design-best-practices-966bbb1d60c5), [Halo Lab](https://www.halo-lab.com/blog/crm-system-design)).
*   **Simple Navigation:** Design clear menus and intuitive layouts for easy information access ([Halo Lab](https://www.halo-lab.com/blog/crm-system-design)).
*   **Scalability and Adaptation:** Design a system that can accommodate business growth and adapt to changes ([Halo Lab](https://www.halo-lab.com/blog/crm-system-design)).
*   **Salesforce Design Patterns:** Utilize established patterns like Factory, Singleton, Decorator, and Strategy to streamline development and improve code quality ([Growth Natives](https://growthnatives.com/blogs/salesforce/salesforce-design-patterns)).
*   **Data Organization:** Implement a well-structured database schema to manage customer data efficiently ([DragonflyDB](https://www.dragonflydb.io/databases/schema/crm)).

Analyzing CRM backend requirements and industry standards to create a feature enhancement plan.

**Raw User Requirements:**
- Add contacts
- Assign tags to contacts
- Create campaigns
- Send emails to contacts filtered by tags
- Backend only, robust and well-structured

**Industry Standards (from research):**
- Contact management with interaction history
- Tagging and segmentation (many-to-many)
- Campaign management (subject, body, scheduling)
- Email sending and logging (with status)
- Automation/workflow support (future-proofing)
- Data security and validation
- Scalable, modular API structure

**High-Value Additions (minimal complexity, high impact):**
- Email send log (track which contacts received which campaign)
- Bulk tag assignment/removal
- Campaign preview endpoint (simulate email send without sending)
- Basic error handling and validation for all endpoints
- Pagination for contact/campaign lists

**Backend Model Relationships:**

**API Route Structure:**

Continuing with the design strategy for the CRM backend:

**Backend Model Relationships:**
- **Contact**: Stores customer info (name, email, etc.)
- **Tag**: For segmentation, many-to-many with contacts
- **ContactTag**: Association table for contacts and tags
- **Campaign**: Stores campaign details (subject, body, target tags)
- **CampaignSend**: Logs which contacts received which campaign email

**API Route Structure:**
- `/contacts/` (CRUD, assign/remove tags, list with pagination)
- `/tags/` (CRUD, list)
- `/campaigns/` (CRUD, list)
- `/campaigns/{id}/send/` (send campaign emails to contacts with selected tags)
- `/campaigns/{id}/preview/` (simulate send, show intended recipients)
- `/campaign_sends/` (list email logs, filter by campaign/contact)

**Email Sending Strategy:**
- Implement a mock email sender (prints to logs, simulates sending)
- Store each send in CampaignSend for traceability

**Data Security & Validation:**
- Validate email addresses on contact creation
- Ensure tags and campaigns exist before assignment/sending
- Handle errors gracefully with clear messages

**Scalability:**
- Modular service structure for easy future expansion (e.g., real email integration, automation)
- Pagination on list endpoints

**Next Steps:**
- Setup backend folder structure for models, services, and routes

<action type="file" filePath="backend/database/contact_tag.py">from db_config import Base
from sqlalchemy import Column, Integer, ForeignKey
from sqlalchemy.orm import relationship

class ContactTag(Base):
    __tablename__ = "contact_tags"
    id = Column(Integer, primary_key=True, index=True)
    contact_id = Column(Integer, ForeignKey("contacts.id", ondelete="CASCADE"))
    tag_id = Column(Integer, ForeignKey("tags.id", ondelete="CASCADE"))

    contact = relationship("Contact", back_populates="tags")
    tag = relationship("Tag", back_populates="contacts")
</action>

        created_at=datetime.utcnow()
    )
    db.add(db_contact)
    db.commit()
    db.refresh(db_contact)
    return db_contact

@router.get("/", response_model=List[ContactOut])
def list_contacts(skip: int = 0, limit: int = 20, db: Session = Depends(get_db)):
    contacts = db.query(Contact).offset(skip).limit(limit).all()
    return contacts

@router.get("/{contact_id}/", response_model=ContactOut)
def get_contact(contact_id: int, db: Session = Depends(get_db)):
    contact = db.query(Contact).filter(Contact.id == contact_id).first()
    if not contact:
        raise HTTPException(status_code=404, detail="Contact not found")
    return contact

@router.put("/{contact_id}/", response_model=ContactOut)
def update_contact(contact_id: int, contact: ContactUpdate, db: Session = Depends(get_db)):
    db_contact = db.query(Contact).filter(Contact.id == contact_id).first()
    if not db_contact:

    db_contact.name = contact.name

    return

<action type="file" filePath="backend/services/campaign_service.py">from fastapi import APIRouter, Depends, HTTPException, status
from sqlalchemy.orm import Session
from db_config import get_db
from database.campaign import Campaign
from database.campaign_send import CampaignSend
from database.contact_tag import ContactTag
from database.contact import Contact
from database.tag import Tag
from models.campaign_models import CampaignCreate, CampaignUpdate, CampaignOut
from models.campaign_send_models import CampaignSendOut
from typing import List
from datetime import datetime

router = APIRouter(prefix="/campaigns", tags=["campaigns"])

@router.post("/", response_model=CampaignOut)
def create_campaign(campaign: CampaignCreate, db: Session = Depends(get_db)):
    print(f"Creating campaign: {campaign.name}")
    db_campaign = Campaign(
        name=campaign.name,
        subject=campaign.subject,
        body=campaign.body,
        created_at=datetime.utcnow()
    )
    db.add(db_campaign)
    db.commit()
    db.refresh(db_campaign)
    return db_campaign

@router.get("/", response_model=List[CampaignOut])
def list_campaigns(skip: int = 0, limit: int = 20, db: Session = Depends(get_db)):
    campaigns = db.query(Campaign).offset(skip).limit(limit).all()
    return campaigns

@router.get("/{campaign_id}/", response_model=CampaignOut)
def get_campaign(campaign_id: int, db: Session = Depends(get_db)):
    campaign = db.query(Campaign).filter(Campaign.id == campaign_id).first()
    if not campaign:
        raise HTTPException(status_code=404, detail="Campaign not found")
    return campaign

@router.put("/{campaign_id}/", response_model=CampaignOut)
def update_campaign(campaign_id: int, campaign: CampaignUpdate, db: Session = Depends(get_db)):
    db_campaign = db.query(Campaign).filter(Campaign.id == campaign_id).first()
    if not db_campaign:
        raise HTTPException(status_code=404, detail="Campaign not found")
    db_campaign.name = campaign.name
    db_campaign.subject = campaign.subject
    db_campaign.body = campaign.body
    db.commit()
    db.refresh(db_campaign)
    return db_campaign

@router.delete("/{campaign_id}/", status_code=status.HTTP_204_NO_CONTENT)
def delete_campaign(campaign_id: int, db: Session = Depends(get_db)):
    db_campaign = db.query(Campaign).filter(Campaign.id == campaign_id).first()
    if not db_campaign:
        raise HTTPException(status_code=404, detail="Campaign not found")
    db.delete(db_campaign)
    db.commit()
    return

# Send campaign to contacts with tag(s)
@router.post("/{campaign_id}/send/", response_model=List[CampaignSendOut])
def send_campaign(campaign_id: int, tag_ids: List[int], db: Session = Depends(get_db)):
    campaign = db.query(Campaign).filter(Campaign.id == campaign_id).first()
    if not campaign:
        raise HTTPException(status_code=404, detail="Campaign not found")
    print(f"Sending campaign {campaign_id} to contacts with tags {tag_ids}")

    # Find contacts with any of the tag_ids
    contact_tags = db.query(ContactTag).filter(ContactTag.tag_id.in_(tag_ids)).all()
    contact_ids = set(ct.contact_id for ct in contact_tags)
    contacts = db.query(Contact).filter(Contact.id.in_(contact_ids)).all()

    sent_logs = []
    for contact in contacts:
        # Simulate sending email (mock)
        print(f"Email sent to {contact.email} for campaign {campaign.subject}")
        send_log = CampaignSend(
            campaign_id=campaign_id,
            contact_id=contact.id,
            sent_at=datetime.utcnow(),
            status="sent"
        )
        db.add(send_log)
        db.commit()
        db.refresh(send_log)
        sent_logs.append(send_log)
    return sent_logs

# Preview campaign recipients without sending
@router.post("/{campaign_id}/preview/", response_model=List[str])
def preview_campaign_recipients(campaign_id: int, tag_ids: List[int], db: Session = Depends(get_db)):
    campaign = db.query(Campaign).filter(Campaign.id == campaign_id).first()
    if not campaign:
        raise HTTPException(status_code=404, detail="Campaign not found")
    contact_tags = db.query(ContactTag).filter(ContactTag.tag_id.in_(tag_ids)).all()
    contact_ids = set(ct.contact_id for ct in contact_tags)
    contacts = db.query(Contact).filter(Contact.id.in_(contact_ids)).all()
    emails = [contact.email for contact in contacts]
    print(f"Preview campaign {campaign_id} will be sent to: {emails}")
    return emails
</action>

Now I'll create the FastAPI service for listing campaign sends (email logs), which allows filtering by campaign or contact.

---

<action type="file" filePath="backend/services/campaign_send_service.py">from fastapi import APIRouter, Depends
from sqlalchemy.orm import Session
from db_config import get_db
from database.campaign_send import CampaignSend
from models.campaign_send_models import CampaignSendOut
from typing import List, Optional

router = APIRouter(prefix="/campaign_sends", tags=["campaign_sends"])

@router.get("/", response_model=List[CampaignSendOut])
def list_campaign_sends(
    campaign_id: Optional[int] = None,
    contact_id: Optional[int] = None,
    db: Session = Depends(get_db)
):
    query = db.query(CampaignSend)
    if campaign_id:
        query = query.filter(CampaignSend.campaign_id == campaign_id)
    if contact_id:
        query = query.filter(CampaignSend.contact_id == contact_id)
    sends = query.order_by(CampaignSend.sent_at.desc()).all()
    return sends
</action>

from db_config import Base, engine
from sqlalchemy import inspect

def test_tables():
    inspector = inspect(engine)
    tables = inspector.get_table_names()
    print("Tables in database:", tables)
    expected_tables = [
        "contacts", "tags", "contact_tags", "campaigns", "campaign_sends"
    ]
    for table in expected_tables:
        assert table in tables, f"Missing table: {table}"
    print("All CRM tables are present.")

    Base.metadata.create_all(bind=engine)
    test_tables()

<action type="update_file" path="backend/test_setup.py">
from db_config import Base, engine
from sqlalchemy import inspect

# Explicitly import all models so SQLAlchemy knows about them
from database.contact import Contact
from database.tag import Tag
from database.contact_tag import ContactTag
from database.campaign import Campaign
from database.campaign_send import CampaignSend

def test_tables():
    inspector = inspect(engine)
    tables = inspector.get_table_names()
    print("Tables in database:", tables)
    expected_tables = [
        "contacts", "tags", "contact_tags", "campaigns", "campaign_sends"
    ]
    for table in expected_tables:
        assert table in tables, f"Missing table: {table}"
    print("All CRM tables are present.")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    # Create tables
    Base.metadata.create_all(bind=engine)
    test_tables()

# CRM Backend Project: Comprehensive Summary
**Project ID:** crm-app-contacts-tags-0813-223956  
**Date:** 2025-08-13  
**Context Version:** 1.0  
**Purpose:** This summary captures the full technical and process context for the CRM backend build. It is intended for developers updating or debugging the codebase at any stage. It includes requirements, design decisions, file and code structure, problem-solving history, errors, and actionable next steps.

---

## 1. OVERALL PROJECT GOAL

**Build a robust CRM backend using FastAPI and SQLAlchemy that provides:**
- Contact management (CRUD: create, read, update, delete)
- Tag management (CRUD) and many-to-many assignment to contacts
- Campaign management (subject, body, targeted tags)
- Email sending to contacts filtered by tags (mock sender for now)
- Persistent logs for campaign sends (email history)
- RESTful API endpoints for all entities
- Clean structure, scalable for frontend integration, modular and future-proof

---

## 2. KEY TECHNICAL CONCEPTS

- **SQLAlchemy ORM:** Used for all database models and relationships.
    - Contact <-> Tag via ContactTag association table (many-to-many)
    - Campaign and CampaignSend for logging campaign email sends

- **Pydantic v2 Schemas:** Used for request/response validation; all endpoint inputs/outputs are strongly typed.

- **FastAPI Routing:** Each entity (contact, tag, campaign, campaign_send) has its own APIRouter for CRUD and management.

- **Mock Email Sender:** For the email send functionality, emails are simulated (logged to console, not sent).

- **Database Initialization:** The models must be imported before table creation; this caused a critical issue during testing.

---

## 3. FUNCTIONAL AND NON-FUNCTIONAL REQUIREMENTS

### **User/Business Requirements**
- Add contacts
- Assign tags to contacts
- Create campaigns
- Send campaigns to filtered contacts (by tags)
- Error handling and validation (e.g., valid emails, not-found errors)
- No user authentication yet (may be added later)

### **Industry Standards (from Research)**
- Unified customer view (single source of truth)
- Tagging/segmentation for contacts
- Bulk tag assign/remove (future)
- Campaign send logging
- Data security/validation
- Pagination for lists
- Automation workflows (future)

### **Key Backend Files & What They Do**
- **database/contact.py**: Contact SQLAlchemy model (id, name, email, created_at, tags)
- **database/tag.py**: Tag SQLAlchemy model (id, name, contacts)
- **database/contact_tag.py**: Association table for many-to-many (id, contact_id, tag_id)
- **database/campaign.py**: Campaign model (id, name, subject, body, created_at)
- **database/campaign_send.py**: Log model for sent campaign emails (id, campaign_id, contact_id, sent_at, status)
- **models/[entity]_models.py**: Pydantic schemas for all CRUD (Create, Update, Out), including from_attributes for SQLAlchemy compatibility.
- **services/[entity]_service.py**: FastAPI routers:
    - CRUD endpoints (POST, GET, PUT, DELETE)
    - Assign/remove tags to contacts
    - Send/preview campaigns (mock sender)
    - List campaign sends/email logs
- **services/__init__.py**: Registers all routers with the root API under tags.

## 5. DETAILED PROBLEM SOLVING HISTORY

### **Design & Planning**
- Used web search to research best practices and industry standards for CRM backends.
- Defined features and design patterns: RESTful, modular endpoints, robust relational schema.

### **Database Table Creation Issue**
- **Problem:** Tables were not being created.  
- **Symptoms:** Running `python test_setup.py` printed `Tables in database: []` followed by `AssertionError: Missing table: contacts`.
- **Root Cause:** SQLAlchemy models were not imported at DB initialization; thus, `Base.metadata.create_all()` was unaware of them.
- **Solutions Applied:**
    1. Updated `backend/database/__init__.py` to import all model classes.
    2. Updated `backend/test_setup.py` to import all model classes before calling `Base.metadata.create_all()`.

### **Backend Startup & Service Registration**
- Backend started cleanly, responding on port 8001 with health route working.
- All service routers registered in `services/__init__.py`.
- Critical warning displayed ("CRITICAL ERRORS - SERVICE BROKEN!") but no actual error found in logs.

import requests

BASE_URL = "http://localhost:8001"

def test_contacts():
    print("Testing /contacts/ endpoint...")
    # Create contact
    r = requests.post(f"{BASE_URL}/contacts/", json={"name": "Alice Smith", "email": "alice@example.com"})
    print("Create contact:", r.status_code, r.json())
    contact_id = r.json().get("id")

    # List contacts
    r = requests.get(f"{BASE_URL}/contacts/")
    print("List contacts:", r.status_code, r.json())

    # Get contact
    r = requests.get(f"{BASE_URL}/contacts/{contact_id}/")
    print("Get contact:", r.status_code, r.json())

    # Update contact
    r = requests.put(f"{BASE_URL}/contacts/{contact_id}/", json={"name": "Alice S.", "email": "alice@example.com"})
    print("Update contact:", r.status_code, r.json())

    # Delete contact
    r = requests.delete(f"{BASE_URL}/contacts/{contact_id}/")
    print("Delete contact:", r.status_code)

def test_tags():
    print("Testing /tags/ endpoint...")
    # Create tag
    r = requests.post(f"{BASE_URL}/tags/", json={"name": "VIP"})
    print("Create tag:", r.status_code, r.json())
    tag_id = r.json().get("id")

    # List tags
    r = requests.get(f"{BASE_URL}/tags/")
    print("List tags:", r.status_code, r.json())

    # Get tag
    r = requests.get(f"{BASE_URL}/tags/{tag_id}/")
    print("Get tag:", r.status_code, r.json())

    # Update tag
    r = requests.put(f"{BASE_URL}/tags/{tag_id}/", json={"name": "Premium"})
    print("Update tag:", r.status_code, r.json())

    # Delete tag
    r = requests.delete(f"{BASE_URL}/tags/{tag_id}/")
    print("Delete tag:", r.status_code)

def test_campaigns():
    print("Testing /campaigns/ endpoint...")
    # Create campaign
    r = requests.post(f"{BASE_URL}/campaigns/", json={"name": "Welcome", "subject": "Hello!", "body": "Welcome to our CRM!"})
    print("Create campaign:", r.status_code, r.json())
    campaign_id = r.json().get("id")

    # List campaigns
    r = requests.get(f"{BASE_URL}/campaigns/")
    print("List campaigns:", r.status_code, r.json())

    # Get campaign
    r = requests.get(f"{BASE_URL}/campaigns/{campaign_id}/")
    print("Get campaign:", r.status_code, r.json())

    # Update campaign
    r = requests.put(f"{BASE_URL}/campaigns/{campaign_id}/", json={"name": "Welcome Updated", "subject": "Hi!", "body": "Glad to have you!"})
    print("Update campaign:", r.status_code, r.json())

    # Delete campaign
    r = requests.delete(f"{BASE_URL}/campaigns/{campaign_id}/")
    print("Delete campaign:", r.status_code)

if __name__ == "__main__":
    test_contacts()
    test_tags()
    test_campaigns()

- **Campaign**: Stores campaign details (subject, body, target tags)
- **CampaignSend**: Logs which contacts received which campaign email

- `/contacts/` (CRUD, assign/remove tags, list with pagination)
- `/tags/` (CRUD, list)
- `/campaigns/` (CRUD, list)
- `/campaigns/{id}/send/` (send campaign emails to contacts with selected tags)
- `/campaigns/{id}/preview/` (simulate send, show intended recipients)
- `/campaign_sends/` (list email logs, filter by campaign/contact)

**Email Sending Strategy:**
- Implement a mock email sender (prints to logs, simulates sending)
- Store each send in CampaignSend for traceability

**Data Security & Validation:**
- Validate email addresses on contact creation
- Ensure tags and campaigns exist before assignment/sending
- Handle errors gracefully with clear messages

**Scalability:**
- Modular service structure for easy future expansion (e.g., real email integration, automation)
- Pagination on list endpoints

<action type="file" filePath="backend/services/contact_service.py">from fastapi import APIRouter, Depends, HTTPException, status
from sqlalchemy.orm import Session
from db_config import get_db
from database.contact import Contact
from database.contact_tag import ContactTag
from models.contact_models import ContactCreate, ContactUpdate, ContactOut
from models.contact_tag_models import ContactTagCreate
from typing import List
from datetime import datetime

router = APIRouter(prefix="/contacts", tags=["contacts"])

@router.post("/", response_model=ContactOut)
def create_contact(contact: ContactCreate, db: Session = Depends(get_db)):
    print(f"Creating contact: {contact.email}")
    db_contact = Contact(
        name=contact.name,
        email=contact.email,
        created_at=datetime.utcnow()
    )
    db.add(db_contact)
    db.commit()
    db.refresh(db_contact)
    return db_contact

@router.get("/", response_model=List[ContactOut])
def list_contacts(skip: int = 0, limit: int = 20, db: Session = Depends(get_db)):
    contacts = db.query(Contact).offset(skip).limit(limit).all()
    return contacts

@router.get("/{contact_id}/", response_model=ContactOut)
def get_contact(contact_id: int, db: Session = Depends(get_db)):
    contact = db.query(Contact).filter(Contact.id == contact_id).first()
    if not contact:
        raise HTTPException(status_code=404, detail="Contact not found")
    return contact

@router.put("/{contact_id}/", response_model=ContactOut)
def update_contact(contact_id: int, contact: ContactUpdate, db: Session = Depends(get_db)):
    db_contact = db.query(Contact).filter(Contact.id == contact_id).first()
    if not db_contact:
        raise HTTPException(status_code=404, detail="Contact not found")
    db_contact.name = contact.name
    db_contact.email = contact.email
    db.commit()
    db.refresh(db_contact)
    return db_contact

@router.delete("/{contact_id}/", status_code=status.HTTP_204_NO_CONTENT)
def delete_contact(contact_id: int, db: Session = Depends(get_db)):
    db_contact = db.query(Contact).filter(Contact.id == contact_id).first()
    if not db_contact:
        raise HTTPException(status_code=404, detail="Contact not found")
    db.delete(db_contact)
    db.commit()
    return

# Assign tag to contact
@router.post("/{contact_id}/tags/", status_code=status.HTTP_201_CREATED)
def assign_tag(contact_id: int, tag: ContactTagCreate, db: Session = Depends(get_db)):
    print(f"Assigning tag {tag.tag_id} to contact {contact_id}")
    db_contact_tag = ContactTag(contact_id=contact_id, tag_id=tag.tag_id)
    db.add(db_contact_tag)
    db.commit()
    db.refresh(db_contact_tag)
    return {"success": True, "contact_tag_id": db_contact_tag.id}

# Remove tag from contact
@router.delete("/{contact_id}/tags/{tag_id}/", status_code=status.HTTP_204_NO_CONTENT)
def remove_tag(contact_id: int, tag_id: int, db: Session = Depends(get_db)):
    db_contact_tag = db.query(ContactTag).filter(
        ContactTag.contact_id == contact_id,
        ContactTag.tag_id == tag_id
    ).first()
    if not db_contact_tag:
        raise HTTPException(status_code=404, detail="Tag assignment not found")
    db.delete(db_contact_tag)
    db.commit()
    return
</action>Continuing backend implementation: I'll now create the FastAPI service for tags, including CRUD and listing endpoints.

<action type="file" filePath="backend/services/campaign_service.py">from fastapi import APIRouter, Depends, HTTPException, status
from sqlalchemy.orm import Session
from db_config import get_db
from database.campaign import Campaign
from database.campaign_send import CampaignSend
from database.contact_tag import ContactTag
from database.contact import Contact
from database.tag import Tag
from models.campaign_models import CampaignCreate, CampaignUpdate, CampaignOut
from models.campaign_send_models import CampaignSendOut
from typing import List
from datetime import datetime

router = APIRouter(prefix="/campaigns", tags=["campaigns"])

@router.post("/", response_model=CampaignOut)
def create_campaign(campaign: CampaignCreate, db: Session = Depends(get_db)):
    print(f"Creating campaign: {campaign.name}")
    db_campaign = Campaign(
        name=campaign.name,
        subject=campaign.subject,
        body=campaign.body,
        created_at=datetime.utcnow()
    )
    db.add(db_campaign)
    db.commit()
    db.refresh(db_campaign)
    return db_campaign

@router.get("/", response_model=List[CampaignOut])
def list_campaigns(skip: int = 0, limit: int = 20, db: Session = Depends(get_db)):
    campaigns = db.query(Campaign).offset(skip).limit(limit).all()
    return campaigns

@router.get("/{campaign_id}/", response_model=CampaignOut)
def get_campaign(campaign_id: int, db: Session = Depends(get_db)):
    campaign = db.query(Campaign).filter(Campaign.id == campaign_id).first()
    if not campaign:
        raise HTTPException(status_code=404, detail="Campaign not found")
    return campaign

@router.put("/{campaign_id}/", response_model=CampaignOut)
def update_campaign(campaign_id: int, campaign: CampaignUpdate, db: Session = Depends(get_db)):
    db_campaign = db.query(Campaign).filter(Campaign.id == campaign_id).first()
    if not db_campaign:
        raise HTTPException(status_code=404, detail="Campaign not found")
    db_campaign.name = campaign.name
    db_campaign.subject = campaign.subject
    db_campaign.body = campaign.body
    db.commit()
    db.refresh(db_campaign)
    return db_campaign

@router.delete("/{campaign_id}/", status_code=status.HTTP_204_NO_CONTENT)
def delete_campaign(campaign_id: int, db: Session = Depends(get_db)):
    db_campaign = db.query(Campaign).filter(Campaign.id == campaign_id).first()
    if not db_campaign:
        raise HTTPException(status_code=404, detail="Campaign not found")
    db.delete(db_campaign)
    db.commit()
    return

# Send campaign to contacts with tag(s)
@router.post("/{campaign_id}/send/", response_model=List[CampaignSendOut])
def send_campaign(campaign_id: int, tag_ids: List[int], db: Session = Depends(get_db)):
    campaign = db.query(Campaign).filter(Campaign.id == campaign_id).first()
    if not campaign:
        raise HTTPException(status_code=404, detail="Campaign not found")
    print(f"Sending campaign {campaign_id} to contacts with tags {tag_ids}")

    # Find contacts with any of the tag_ids
    contact_tags = db.query(ContactTag).filter(ContactTag.tag_id.in_(tag_ids)).all()
    contact_ids = set(ct.contact_id for ct in contact_tags)
    contacts = db.query(Contact).filter(Contact.id.in_(contact_ids)).all()

    sent_logs = []
    for contact in contacts:
        # Simulate sending email (mock)
        print(f"Email sent to {contact.email} for campaign {campaign.subject}")
        send_log = CampaignSend(
            campaign_id=campaign_id,
            contact_id=contact.id,
            sent_at=datetime.utcnow(),
            status="sent"
        )
        db.add(send_log)
        db.commit()
        db.refresh(send_log)
        sent_logs.append(send_log)
    return sent_logs

# Preview campaign recipients without sending
@router.post("/{campaign_id}/preview/", response_model=List[str])
def preview_campaign_recipients(campaign_id: int, tag_ids: List[int], db: Session = Depends(get_db)):
    campaign = db.query(Campaign).filter(Campaign.id == campaign_id).first()
    if not campaign:
        raise HTTPException(status_code=404, detail="Campaign not found")
    contact_tags = db.query(ContactTag).filter(ContactTag.tag_id.in_(tag_ids)).all()
    contact_ids = set(ct.contact_id for ct in contact_tags)
    contacts = db.query(Contact).filter(Contact.id.in_(contact_ids)).all()
    emails = [contact.email for contact in contacts]
    print(f"Preview campaign {campaign_id} will be sent to: {emails}")
    return emails
</action>Now I'll create the FastAPI service for listing campaign sends (email logs), which allows filtering by campaign or contact.

<action type="file" filePath="backend/services/campaign_send_service.py">from fastapi import APIRouter, Depends
from sqlalchemy.orm import Session
from db_config import get_db
from database.campaign_send import CampaignSend
from models.campaign_send_models import CampaignSendOut
from typing import List, Optional

router = APIRouter(prefix="/campaign_sends", tags=["campaign_sends"])

@router.get("/", response_model=List[CampaignSendOut])
def list_campaign_sends(
    campaign_id: Optional[int] = None,
    contact_id: Optional[int] = None,
    db: Session = Depends(get_db)
):
    query = db.query(CampaignSend)
    if campaign_id:
        query = query.filter(CampaignSend.campaign_id == campaign_id)
    if contact_id:
        query = query.filter(CampaignSend.contact_id == contact_id)
    sends = query.order_by(CampaignSend.sent_at.desc()).all()
    return sends

import requests

BASE_URL = "http://localhost:8001"

def test_contacts():
    print("Testing /contacts/ endpoint...")
    # Create contact
    r = requests.post(f"{BASE_URL}/contacts/", json={"name": "Alice Smith", "email": "alice@example.com"})
    print("Create contact:", r.status_code, r.json())
    contact_id = r.json().get("id")

    # List contacts
    r = requests.get(f"{BASE_URL}/contacts/")
    print("List contacts:", r.status_code, r.json())

    # Get contact
    r = requests.get(f"{BASE_URL}/contacts/{contact_id}/")
    print("Get contact:", r.status_code, r.json())

    # Update contact
    r = requests.put(f"{BASE_URL}/contacts/{contact_id}/", json={"name": "Alice S.", "email": "alice@example.com"})
    print("Update contact:", r.status_code, r.json())

    # Delete contact
    r = requests.delete(f"{BASE_URL}/contacts/{contact_id}/")
    print("Delete contact:", r.status_code)

def test_tags():
    print("Testing /tags/ endpoint...")
    # Create tag
    r = requests.post(f"{BASE_URL}/tags/", json={"name": "VIP"})
    print("Create tag:", r.status_code, r.json())
    tag_id = r.json().get("id")

    # List tags
    r = requests.get(f"{BASE_URL}/tags/")
    print("List tags:", r.status_code, r.json())

    # Get tag
    r = requests.get(f"{BASE_URL}/tags/{tag_id}/")
    print("Get tag:", r.status_code, r.json())

    # Update tag
    r = requests.put(f"{BASE_URL}/tags/{tag_id}/", json={"name": "Premium"})
    print("Update tag:", r.status_code, r.json())

    # Delete tag
    r = requests.delete(f"{BASE_URL}/tags/{tag_id}/")
    print("Delete tag:", r.status_code)

def test_campaigns():
    print("Testing /campaigns/ endpoint...")
    # Create campaign
    r = requests.post(f"{BASE_URL}/campaigns/", json={"name": "Welcome", "subject": "Hello!", "body": "Welcome to our CRM!"})
    print("Create campaign:", r.status_code, r.json())
    campaign_id = r.json().get("id")

    # List campaigns
    r = requests.get(f"{BASE_URL}/campaigns/")
    print("List campaigns:", r.status_code, r.json())

    # Get campaign
    r = requests.get(f"{BASE_URL}/campaigns/{campaign_id}/")
    print("Get campaign:", r.status_code, r.json())

    # Update campaign
    r = requests.put(f"{BASE_URL}/campaigns/{campaign_id}/", json={"name": "Welcome Updated", "subject": "Hi!", "body": "Glad to have you!"})
    print("Update campaign:", r.status_code, r.json())

    # Delete campaign
    r = requests.delete(f"{BASE_URL}/campaigns/{campaign_id}/")
    print("Delete campaign:", r.status_code)

if __name__ == "__main__":
    test_contacts()
    test_tags()
    test_campaigns()

I'll build a modern CRM UI for you that connects to your backend and lets you manage contacts, tags, and campaigns with a beautiful, professional interface.

**Based on your CRM requirements, the frontend will include:**
- Contact management: Add, edit, delete contacts; view contact details and tags
- Tag management: Create, edit, delete tags; assign/remove tags to contacts
- Campaign management: Create, edit, delete campaigns; send campaigns to contacts filtered by tags; view campaign logs
- Dashboard-style layout with sidebar navigation and clear sections
- Responsive, elegant design using shadcn/ui and Tailwind
- Zustand for all state management and persistence
- Custom color theme for a trustworthy, modern CRM feel

**Design decisions:**
- **Color scheme:** Blues, teals, and whites for trust, clarity, and professionalism
- **Layout:** Sidebar dashboard, main content area with cards/tables, modal dialogs for forms
- **Typography:** Medium-bold headings, readable body, clear hierarchy
- **Component styling:** Rounded cards, subtle shadows, consistent spacing, interactive states
- **Authentication:** Not needed for MVP (can be added later)
- **Key features:** Fast, intuitive workflow for managing contacts, tags, and campaigns

Web search completed for: "best CRM frontend UI features and design patterns"

**Search Results:**
The best CRM frontend UI features and design patterns should prioritize user experience and efficiency. Key features include:

*   **User-Friendly Interface:** An intuitive interface with clear labels, easy navigation, and customizable dashboards is crucial for team adoption and effective use ([Aufait UX](https://www.aufaitux.com/blog/crm-ux-design-best-practices), [Clarify](https://www.clarify.ai/blog/top-crm-designs-enhancing-user-experience-and-efficiency)).
*   **Mobile Accessibility:** A responsive design or dedicated mobile app ensures users can access and update data on the go ([Excited agency](https://www.excited.agency/blog/crm-design), [Clarify](https://www.clarify.ai/blog/top-crm-designs-enhancing-user-experience-and-efficiency)).
*   **Integration Capabilities:** Seamless integration with other software and applications streamlines workflows and enhances overall efficiency ([Clarify](https://www.clarify.ai/blog/top-crm-designs-enhancing-user-experience-and-efficiency), [Excited agency](https://www.excited.agency/blog/crm-design)).
*   **Advanced Analytics and Reporting:** Tools to track KPIs, measure campaign effectiveness, and derive actionable insights are essential for data-driven decision-making ([Clarify](https://www.clarify.ai/blog/top-crm-designs-enhancing-user-experience-and-efficiency)).
*   **Personalization and Customization:** Tailoring interactions and communications based on customer preferences and behavior enhances customer satisfaction and engagement ([Clarify](https://www.clarify.ai/blog/top-crm-designs-enhancing-user-experience-and-efficiency)).

Design patterns should focus on clear information architecture, modularity, and intuitive navigation to reduce cognitive load and empower users ([Excited agency](https://www.excited.agency/blog/crm-design)).

Continuing with the CRM frontend design strategy:

**Visual Identity Decisions:**
- **Color scheme:**  
  - Primary: #2563eb (blue-600, trust/professional)  
  - Accent: #14b8a6 (teal-500, modern/fresh)  
  - Background: #f8fafc (gray-50, clean/light)  
  - Card: #ffffff (white, clarity)  
  - Danger: #ef4444 (red-500, error)  
- **Typography:**  
  - Headings: Semi-bold, 1.25rem+  
  - Body: Regular, 1rem  
  - Labels: Uppercase, small, medium weight  
- **Layout:**  
  - Sidebar navigation (contacts, tags, campaigns, logs)  
  - Main content area: cards, tables, modals  
  - Responsive for mobile/tablet

**Component Patterns:**  
- Cards for entity display  
- Tables for lists  
- Modals for forms  
- Badges for tags  
- Buttons: rounded, color-accented, clear states  
- Loading skeletons for async data

**Interaction Patterns:**  
- Smooth transitions for modals  
- Hover effects for buttons and cards  
- Error/success toasts (shadcn/sonner)  
- Loading spinners/skeletons

**Next:** Update the color scheme in `src/index.css` and set up the folder/component structure for CRM pages, Zustand stores, and API services.
